5119.quoteText:
Children Under the Age of 13 The Brainly Services and Brainly Subscriptions are not intended for children under 13 years of age.
We do not knowingly collect or solicit personal information from anyone under the age of 13 or knowingly allow such persons to register.
If you believe that we might have any personal information from or about a child under 13, please contact us at
privacy@brainly.com.
5119.title: This service is only available to users 13 years old and over

tosdr.case: This service is only available to users of a certain age
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part A, applicable to users unless you are in Europe) state that, "The Brainly Services and Brainly Subscriptions are not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect or solicit personal information from anyone under the age of 13 or knowingly allow such persons to register." The Terms of Use (in Part B, applicable to users in Europe) state that, "You must be 13 years or older to use Brainly Services."

5144.quoteText:
We participate in interest-based advertising and use third party advertising companies to serve you targeted advertisements based on your online browsing history and your interests.
 We permit third party online advertising networks, social media companies and other third party services, to collect, information about your use of our Service over time so that they may play or display ads on our Service, on other websites, apps or services you may use, and on other devices you may use.
Typically, though not always, the information used for interest-based advertising is collected through cookies or similar tracking technologies.
We may share a common account identifier (such as an email address or user ID) or hashed data with our third party advertising partners to help identify you across devices.
We and our third party partners use this information to make the advertisements you see online more relevant to your interests, as well as to provide advertising-related services such as reporting, attribution, analytics and market research.
5144.title: This service uses third-party cookies for statistics

tosdr.case: This service uses third-party cookies for statistics
tosdr.tldr: The Privacy Policy states, "We participate in interest-based advertising and use third party advertising companies to serve you targeted advertisements based on your online browsing history and your interests.  We permit third party online advertising networks, social media companies and other third party services, to collect, information about your use of our Service over time so that they may play or display ads on our Service, on other websites, apps or services you may use, and on other devices you may use. Typically, though not always, the information used for interest-based advertising is collected through cookies or similar tracking technologies. We and our third party partners use this information to make the advertisements you see online more relevant to your interests, as well as to provide advertising-related services such as reporting, attribution, analytics and market research."

5145.quoteText:
13.1 We may revise these Terms of Use from time to time but the most current version will always be at https://brainly.com/pages/terms_of_use.

13.2 Changes will usually occur because of new features being added to the Service, changes in the law or where we need to clarify our position on something.

13.3 Normally, we will try to give you some warning before the new terms become effective. However, sometimes changes will need to be made immediately and if this happens we will not give you any notice.
5145.title: Terms of Use may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to the user

tosdr.case: Terms may be changed any time at their discretion, without notice to the user
tosdr.tldr: In the Terms of Use applicable to users in Europe, "We may revise these Terms of Use from time to time but the most current version will always be at https://brainly.com/pages/terms_of_use. Changes will usually occur because of new features being added to the Service, changes in the law or where we need to clarify our position on something. Normally, we will try to give you some warning before the new terms become effective. However, sometimes changes will need to be made immediately and if this happens we will not give you any notice." In the Terms of Use applicable to users not in Europe, "Brainly regularly reviews these Terms and may revise or update them at our sole discretion. Changes to these Terms become effective immediately upon their posting on the Brainly Services and your continued use of the Brainly Services following the posting of revised Terms represents that you have read, understood, and agreed to the changes."

5146.quoteText:

When we change the policy in a material manner we will let you know and update the ‘last modified’ date at the bottom of this page.
If you object to any changes, you may close your account.
Continuing to use our Service after we publish changes to this Privacy Policy means that you are consenting to the changes.

5154.quoteText:
Brainly reserves the right to view, monitor, and record activity on the Brainly Services without notice or permission.
We may monitor use to optimize the Brainly Services, understand what is of interest to visitors, and otherwise to enhance the operation of the Brainly Services, assure its availability, and prevent misuse of the Brainly Services.
Any information obtained by monitoring, reviewing, or recording activity on the Brainly Services is subject to review by us or on our behalf as well as by law enforcement organizations in connection with investigation or prosecution of possible criminal activity on the Brainly Services.
Brainly will comply with all court orders involving requests for such information.
5154.title: The service is transparent regarding government requests or inquiries that may involve user data.

tosdr.case: The service is transparent regarding government requests or inquiries that may involve user data.
tosdr.tldr:
The Terms of Use (in Part A, applicable to users unless you are in Europe) state, "Any information obtained by monitoring, reviewing, or recording activity on the Brainly Services is subject to review by us or on our behalf as well as by law enforcement organizations in connection with investigation or prosecution of possible criminal activity on the Brainly Services. Brainly will comply with all court orders involving requests for such information."

 It is also stated in the Privacy Policy that personal information may be shared with "third parties as required by law or subpoena or if we reasonably believe that such action is necessary to (a) comply with the law and the reasonable requests of law enforcement; (b) to enforce our Terms of Service or to protect the security or integrity of our Service; and/or (c) to exercise or protect the rights, property, or personal safety of Brainly, our visitors, or others."

5155.quoteText: Brainly reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to immediately modify, suspend or terminate your account, the Brainly Services, your Brainly Subscription, and/or any products, services, functionality, information, content or other materials available on, through or in connection with the Brainly Services and/or your Brainly Subscription, including, but not limited to, the Mobile Software, and/or your access to some or all of them without cause and without notice. 5157.quoteText:
If you are located in the EU or Switzerland, you have the following rights in respect of your personal data that we hold:

  1. Right of access. The right to obtain access to your personal data.
  2. Right to rectification. The right to obtain rectification of your personal data without undue delay where that personal data is inaccurate or incomplete.
  3. Right to erasure. The right to obtain the erasure of your personal data without undue delay in certain circumstances, such as where the personal data is no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which it was collected or processed.
5157.title: If you are located in the EU or Switzerland, you can request access and deletion of personal data

tosdr.case: You can request access and deletion of personal data
tosdr.tldr: The Privacy Policy states that, "If you are located in the EU or Switzerland, you have the following rights in respect of your personal data that we hold: Right of access. The right to obtain access to your personal data. Right to rectification. The right to obtain rectification of your personal data without undue delay where that personal data is inaccurate or incomplete. Right to erasure. The right to obtain the erasure of your personal data without undue delay in certain circumstances, such as where the personal data is no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which it was collected or processed . . . If you wish to exercise one of these rights, please contact us using the contact details at the end of this Privacy Policy." FOR ALL USERS, these Privacy Policy terms apply: "If you have any questions about reviewing, modifying, or deleting your information, or if you want to remove your name or comments from our Service or publicly displayed content, you can contact us directly at privacy@brainly.com. We may not be able to modify or delete your information in all circumstances. To request deletion of the personal information we have collected in connection with your Brainly account, please select the “I want to delete my account” option after logging into your account in Account Preferences. "

5170.quoteText:
The categories of information we collect can include:

  • Information you provide to us directly. We may collect personal information, such as your name, address, telephone number, date of birth, payment information, and e-mail address when you when you register for our Service, sign up for our mailing list, enter a contest or sweepstakes, or otherwise communicate with us. We may also collect any communications between you and Brainly and any other information you provide to Brainly.
  • Data collected through the use of the Service. We collect information about how you use the Service, your actions on the Service, and content you post to the Service, including the groups you belong to, your interaction with others on the Service, and content you post to the Service, and any content you provide through messages, chat, or other functionality ("User Content"). Please remember that Brainly may, but has no obligation to, monitor, record, and store User Content in order to protect your safety or the safety of other users, to assist with regulatory or law enforcement efforts, or to protect and defend our rights and property. By using the Service, you consent to the recording, storage and disclosure of such communications you send or receive for these purposes.
5170.title: The service provides details about what kinds of personal information they collect

tosdr.case: The service provides details about what kinds of personal information they collect
tosdr.tldr: The Privacy Policy provides details about what kinds of personal information they collect.

5171.quoteText:
We use this information above to operate, maintain, and provide to you the features and functionality of the Service, complete transactions or services requested by you, tailor our programming and services to meet your needs and interests, as well as to communicate directly with you, such as to send you email messages. We may also send you Service-related emails or messages (e.g., account verification, change or updates to features of the Service, technical and security notices). For more information about your communication preferences, see “Control Over Your Information” below.

If you choose not to provide personal data, we may not be able to provide the Service to you or respond to your other requests
5171.title: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data

tosdr.case: The service provides information about how they intend to use your personal data
tosdr.tldr: In the Privacy Policy, it states that the information collected by Brainly is used "to operate, maintain, and provide to you the features and functionality of the Service, complete transactions or services requested by you, tailor our programming and services to meet your needs and interests, as well as to communicate directly with you, such as to send you email messages. We may also send you Service-related emails or messages (e.g., account verification, change or updates to features of the Service, technical and security notices) . . . If you choose not to provide personal data, we may not be able to provide the Service to you or respond to your other requests."

5172.quoteText: use Brainly Services if we have suspended your access to it, or have otherwise banned you from using it;
5172.title: Users who have been permanently banned from this service are not allowed to re-register under a new account

tosdr.case: Users who have been permanently banned from this service are not allowed to re-register under a new account
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part B, applicable to users in Europe) state that you must not "use Brainly Services if we have suspended your access to it, or have otherwise banned you from using it."

5173.quoteText: You agree not to post on or transmit onto the Brainly Services or Mobile Software any information that you know to be untrue, that is unlawful, fraudulent, threatening, malicious, harassing, abusive, libelous, defamatory, obscene, or otherwise objectionable or harmful, or that contains or links to a virus, bug, worm, malware, Trojan horse, or other harmful or disruptive element
5173.title: Users agree not to submit illegal content

tosdr.case: Users agree not to submit illegal content
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part A, applicable to users unless you are in Europe) state that, "You agree not to post on or transmit onto the Brainly Services or Mobile Software any information that you know to be untrue, that is unlawful, fraudulent, threatening, malicious, harassing, abusive, libelous, defamatory, obscene, or otherwise objectionable or harmful, or that contains or links to a virus, bug, worm, malware, Trojan horse, or other harmful or disruptive element. The Terms of Use (in Part B, applicable to users in Europe) state that, "You must only use Brainly Services for lawful and information purposes."

5174.quoteText:
5.1 The Service may, from time to time, contain links to and from third party services.
If you follow a link to any of these services, please note that these services have their own privacy policies and that we do not accept any responsibility or liability for their policies.
Please check the individual policies before you submit any information to those services.
5174.title: The service informs users that its privacy policy does not apply to third party websites

tosdr.case: The service informs users that its privacy policy does not apply to third party websites
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part B, applicable to users in Europe) states that "the Service may, from time to time, contain links to and from third party services. If you follow a link to any of these services, please note that these services have their own privacy policies and that we do not accept any responsibility or liability for their policies. Please check the individual policies before you submit any information to those services."

5175.quoteText: We may also share information with others in an aggregated or otherwise anonymized form that does not reasonably identify you directly as an individual.
5175.title: This service will continue using anonymized user-generated content even after erasure of personal information

tosdr.case: This service will continue using anonymized user-generated content even after erasure of personal information
tosdr.tldr:
The FAQ page (https://faq.brainly.com/hc/en-us/articles/206193329-Can-I-delete-my-question-or-answer-) states that "questions and answers are only removed if they do not meet our posting guidelines, or violate one of our site rules. Since your question or answer might help other students, we aim to preserve all content posted on the site which can be accessed by anyone in the future who might need the information for a school assignment or project." The Privacy Policy also states that "your content and comments you post to public areas of the Service will be viewable by others on the Service and the public," and that "we may also share information with others in an aggregated or otherwise anonymized form that does not reasonably identify you directly as an individual." 

 With regards to modifying or deleting your information, the Privacy Policy says, "If you have any questions about reviewing, modifying, or deleting your information, or if you want to remove your name or comments from our Service or publicly displayed content, you can contact us directly at privacy@brainly.com. We may not be able to modify or delete your information in all circumstances." Moreover, the right to erasure (which only applies for users in the EU and Switzerland) specified in the Privacy Policy only applies under "certain circumstances, such as where the personal data is no longer necessary in relation to the purposes for which it was collected or processed." 

If Brainly aims to "preserve all content posted on the site," then we can conclude that such personal data is still necessary for the purpose of the site. There are places on the site where answers without usernames or profile pictures are visible.

5182.quoteText: <li>Not use the Brainly Services do anything unlawful, misleading, malicious, or discriminatory
5182.title: Users agree not to submit libelous, harassing or threatening content

tosdr.case: Users agree not to submit libelous, harassing or threatening content
tosdr.tldr: The Community Guidelines state that user should "not use the Brainly Services do anything unlawful, misleading, malicious, or discriminatory." The Terms of Use also state, "You agree not to post on or transmit onto the Brainly Services or Mobile Software any information that you know to be untrue, that is unlawful, fraudulent, threatening, malicious, harassing, abusive, libelous, defamatory, obscene, or otherwise objectionable or harmful, or that contains or links to a virus, bug, worm, malware, Trojan horse, or other harmful or disruptive element."

5183.quoteText: 14.3 If you do not comply with these Terms of Use and we do not take action immediately, this does not mean we have given up any right we have and we may still take action in the future.
5183.title: Failure to enforce any provision of the Terms of Service does not constitute a waiver of such provision

tosdr.case: Failure to enforce any provision of the Terms of Service does not constitute a waiver of such provision
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part B, applicable to users in Europe) state that, "If you do not comply with these Terms of Use and we do not take action immediately, this does not mean we have given up any right we have and we may still take action in the future."

5184.title: This service prohibits users sending chain letters, junk mail, spam or any unsolicited messages

tosdr.case: This service prohibits users sending chain letters, junk mail, spam or any unsolicited messages
tosdr.tldr: From the Brainly FAQ (https://faq.brainly.com/hc/en-us/articles/205369412-What-makes-a-great-answer-), it states, "Don’t spam or advertise Brainly is for learning, not promoting! An answer is not the place to advertise your own site."

5211.quoteText: We typically collect this information through a variety of tracking technologies, including cookies, web beacons, Locally Stored Objects (LSOs such as Flash or HTML5), log files, and similar technology (collectively, “tracking technologies”)
5211.title: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.

tosdr.case: The service may use tracking pixels, web beacons, browser fingerprinting, and/or device fingerprinting on users.
tosdr.tldr: The Privacy Poilicy says Brainly can track usage information and personal information "through a variety of tracking technologies, including cookies, web beacons, Locally Stored Objects (LSOs such as Flash or HTML5), log files, and similar technology (collectively, “tracking technologies”)."

5212.quoteText: We value hearing from our users, and are always interested in learning about ways we can improve the Service. By providing your feedback you agree that you are giving up any rights you have in your feedback so that we may use and allow others to use it without any restriction and without any payment to you.
5212.title: If you offer suggestions to the service, they become the owner of the ideas that you give them

tosdr.case: If you offer suggestions to the service, they become the owner of the ideas that you give them
tosdr.tldr: From the Terms of Use (Part B, applicable to users in Europe), it states, "We value hearing from our users, and are always interested in learning about ways we can improve the Service. By providing your feedback you agree that you are giving up any rights you have in your feedback so that we may use and allow others to use it without any restriction and without any payment to you."

The Service may contain links to and from third party websites of our business partners, advertisers, and social media sites and our users may post links to third party websites.
If you follow a link to any of these websites, please note that these websites have their own privacy policies and that we do not accept any responsibility or liability for their policies.
5228.title: This service assumes no responsibility and liability for the contents of links to other websites

tosdr.case: This service assumes no responsibility and liability for the contents of links to other websites
tosdr.tldr: The Privacy Policy states, "The Service may contain links to and from third party websites of our business partners, advertisers, and social media sites and our users may post links to third party websites. If you follow a link to any of these websites, please note that these websites have their own privacy policies and that we do not accept any responsibility or liability for their policies."

5229.quoteText:
We strongly recommend that you read their privacy policies and terms and conditions of use to understand how they collect, use, and share information.
We are not responsible for the privacy practices or the content on the websites of third party sites.
5229.title: The service informs users that its privacy policy does not apply to third party websites

tosdr.case: The service informs users that its privacy policy does not apply to third party websites
tosdr.tldr: The Privacy Policy states that in regard to links to and from third party websites, "We strongly recommend that you read their privacy policies and terms and conditions of use to understand how they collect, use, and share information. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or the content on the websites of third party sites."

5249.title: The service allows you to use pseudonyms

tosdr.case: The service allows you to use pseudonyms
tosdr.tldr: The FAQ states that "usernames can only be changed in extreme cases, like accidentally using your real name or giving out identifying information," meaning that you are allowed to use pseudonyms as a username.

5250.title: This service keeps a license on user-generated content even after users close their accounts.

tosdr.case: This service keeps a license on user-generated content even after users close their accounts.
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part A, applicable to users not in Europe) state, "By posting Your Content on the Brainly Services you irrevocably grant Brainly worldwide, non-exclusive, irrevocable, assignable and transferable perpetual rights to use Your Content."

5251.title: This service can license user content to third parties

tosdr.case: This service can license user content to third parties
tosdr.tldr: The Terms of Use (in Part A, applicable to users not in Europe) state, "By posting Your Content on the Brainly Services you irrevocably grant Brainly worldwide, non-exclusive, irrevocable, assignable and transferable perpetual rights to use Your Content, including, for example, your name, grade, school name or biographical information, for any purpose whatsoever." The Terms of Use (in Part B, applicable to users in Europe) state that Brainly has a "worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free and perpetual licence to use, copy, reproduce, distribute, adapt, re-format, modify, publish, translate, license, sub-license and otherwise make available the User Content anywhere and in any form for the purposes of providing the Service."
